segment.source: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component

segment.source: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component

segment.source: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component
segment.target: How to Install and Configure the MED-V Server Component

segment.source: This section explains how to install and configure the MED-V server.
segment.target: This section explains how to install and configure the MED-V server.

segment.source: How to Install the MED-V Server
segment.target: How to Install the MED-V Server

segment.source: To install the MED-V server
segment.target: To install the MED-V server

segment.source: Install the MED-V Server .msi package.
segment.target: Install the MED-V Server .msi package.

segment.source: The MED-V Server .msi package is called MED-VServerx.msi, where x is the version number.
segment.target: The MED-V Server .msi package is called MED-VServerx.msi, where x is the version number.

segment.source: For example, MED-VServer1.0.65.msi.
segment.target: For example, MED-VServer1.0.65.msi.

segment.source: When the InstallShield Wizard Welcome screen appears, click Next.
segment.target: When the InstallShield Wizard Welcome screen appears, click Next.

segment.source: On the License Agreement screen, read the license agreement, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and then click Next.
segment.target: On the License Agreement screen, read the license agreement, click I accept the terms in the license agreement, and then click Next.

segment.source: The Destination Folder screen appears, with the default installation folder displayed.
segment.target: The Destination Folder screen appears, with the default installation folder displayed.

segment.source: The default installation folder is %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization.
segment.target: The default installation folder is %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization.

segment.source: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change and browse to an existing folder.
segment.target: To change the folder where MED-V should be installed, click Change and browse to an existing folder.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: On the Ready to Install the Program screen, click Install.
segment.target: On the Ready to Install the Program screen, click Install.

segment.source: The MED-V server installation starts.
segment.target: The MED-V server installation starts.

segment.source: This can take several minutes, and the screen might not display text.
segment.target: This can take several minutes, and the screen might not display text.

segment.source: During installation, several progress screens appear.
segment.target: During installation, several progress screens appear.

segment.source: If a message appears, follow the instructions provided.
segment.target: If a message appears, follow the instructions provided.

segment.source: When the InstallShield Wizard Completed screen appears, click Finish to complete the wizard.
segment.target: When the InstallShield Wizard Completed screen appears, click Finish to complete the wizard.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are installing the MED-V server via Microsoft Remote Desktop, use the following syntax: mstsc/admin.
segment.target: If you are installing the MED-V server via Microsoft Remote Desktop, use the following syntax: mstsc/admin.

segment.source: Ensure that your RDP session is directed to the console.
segment.target: Ensure that your RDP session is directed to the console.

segment.source: How to Configure the MED-V Server
segment.target: How to Configure the MED-V Server

segment.source: The following server settings can be configured:
segment.target: The following server settings can be configured:

segment.source: Connections
segment.target: Connections

segment.source: Images
segment.target: Images

segment.source: Permissions
segment.target: Permissions

segment.source: Reports
segment.target: Reports

segment.source: Configuring Connections
segment.target: Configuring Connections

segment.source: To configure connections
segment.target: To configure connections

segment.source: On the Windows Start menu, select All Programs MED-V MED-V Server Configuration Manager.
segment.target: On the Windows Start menu, select All Programs MED-V MED-V Server Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Note: If you selected the Launch MED-V Server Configuration Manager check box during the server installation, the MED-V server configuration manager starts automatically after the server installation is complete.
segment.target: Note: If you selected the Launch MED-V Server Configuration Manager check box during the server installation, the MED-V server configuration manager starts automatically after the server installation is complete.

segment.source: The MED-V Server Configuration Manager appears.
segment.target: The MED-V Server Configuration Manager appears.

segment.source: On the Connections tab, configure the following client connections settings:
segment.target: On the Connections tab, configure the following client connections settings:

segment.source: Enable unencrypted connections (http), using port—Select this check box to enable unencrypted connections using a specified port.
segment.target: Enable unencrypted connections (http), using port—Select this check box to enable unencrypted connections using a specified port.

segment.source: In the port box, enter the server port on which to accept unencrypted connections (http).
segment.target: In the port box, enter the server port on which to accept unencrypted connections (http).

segment.source: Enable encrypted connections (https), using port—Select this check box to enable encrypted connections using a specified port.
segment.target: Enable encrypted connections (https), using port—Select this check box to enable encrypted connections using a specified port.

segment.source: In the port box, enter the server port on which to accept encrypted connections (https).
segment.target: In the port box, enter the server port on which to accept encrypted connections (https).

segment.source: Https is an optional configuration which can be set to ensure secure transactions between the MED-V server and MED-V clients.
segment.target: Https is an optional configuration which can be set to ensure secure transactions between the MED-V server and MED-V clients.

segment.source: To configure https, you must perform the following procedures:
segment.target: To configure https, you must perform the following procedures:

segment.source: Configure a certificate on the server.
segment.target: Configure a certificate on the server.

segment.source: Associate the server certificate with the port specified using netsh.
segment.target: Associate the server certificate with the port specified using netsh.

segment.source: For information, see the following:
segment.target: For information, see the following:

segment.source: Netsh Commands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
segment.target: Netsh Commands for Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)

segment.source: How to: Configure a Port with an SSL Certificate
segment.target: How to: Configure a Port with an SSL Certificate

segment.source: How to: Configure a Port with an SSL Certificate
segment.target: How to: Configure a Port with an SSL Certificate

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Configuring Images
segment.target: Configuring Images

segment.source: To configure images
segment.target: To configure images

segment.source: Click the Images tab.
segment.target: Click the Images tab.

segment.source: Configure the following image management settings:
segment.target: Configure the following image management settings:

segment.source: VMs Directory—The virtual machine directory (the directory where the images are stored).
segment.target: VMs Directory—The virtual machine directory (the directory where the images are stored).

segment.source: This field contains a UNC path to the image directory on the image distribution server that should be accessible from the MED-V server.
segment.target: This field contains a UNC path to the image directory on the image distribution server that should be accessible from the MED-V server.

segment.source: VMs URL—The location of the server where the images are stored.
segment.target: VMs URL—The location of the server where the images are stored.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Configuring Permissions
segment.target: Configuring Permissions

segment.source: To configure permissions
segment.target: To configure permissions

segment.source: Click the Permissions tab.
segment.target: Click the Permissions tab.

segment.source: A list of all users who can log in is provided.
segment.target: A list of all users who can log in is provided.

segment.source: To apply read and write permissions to a user, select the check box next to the user.
segment.target: To apply read and write permissions to a user, select the check box next to the user.

segment.source: To apply read-only permissions to a user, clear the check box.
segment.target: To apply read-only permissions to a user, clear the check box.

segment.source: To add domain users or groups, click Add.
segment.target: To add domain users or groups, click Add.

segment.source: The Enter User or Group names dialog box appears.
segment.target: The Enter User or Group names dialog box appears.

segment.source: Select domain users or groups by doing one of the following:
segment.target: Select domain users or groups by doing one of the following:

segment.source: In the Enter User or Group names field, type a user or group that exists in the domain or exists as a local user or group on the computer.
segment.target: In the Enter User or Group names field, type a user or group that exists in the domain or exists as a local user or group on the computer.

segment.source: Then click Check Names to resolve it to the full existent name.
segment.target: Then click Check Names to resolve it to the full existent name.

segment.source: Click Find to open the standard Select Users or Groups dialog box.
segment.target: Click Find to open the standard Select Users or Groups dialog box.

segment.source: Then select domain users or groups.
segment.target: Then select domain users or groups.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: To remove domain users or groups, select a user or group and click Remove.
segment.target: To remove domain users or groups, select a user or group and click Remove.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: Configuring Reports
segment.target: Configuring Reports

segment.source: To configure reports
segment.target: To configure reports

segment.source: Click the Reports tab.
segment.target: Click the Reports tab.

segment.source: To support reports, select Enable reports.
segment.target: To support reports, select Enable reports.

segment.source: In the Connection String box, enter a connection string for the MSSQL database.
segment.target: In the Connection String box, enter a connection string for the MSSQL database.

segment.source: When SQL Server is installed on a remote server, use the following connection string:
segment.target: When SQL Server is installed on a remote server, use the following connection string:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Note: To connect to SQL Express, use:
segment.target: Note: To connect to SQL Express, use:

segment.source: To create the database, click Create Database.
segment.target: To create the database, click Create Database.

segment.source: To test the connection, click Test Connection.
segment.target: To test the connection, click Test Connection.

segment.source: To configure database clearing options, click Clear Options.
segment.target: To configure database clearing options, click Clear Options.

segment.source: The Clear Database Options dialog box appears.
segment.target: The Clear Database Options dialog box appears.

segment.source: Choose one of the following options:
segment.target: Choose one of the following options:

segment.source: Clear data older than—Clear all data older than the number of days specified; in the number box, enter a number of days.
segment.target: Clear data older than—Clear all data older than the number of days specified; in the number box, enter a number of days.

segment.source: Clear all data from database—Clear all existent data in the database.
segment.target: Clear all data from database—Clear all existent data in the database.

segment.source: Drop database—Delete the database.
segment.target: Drop database—Delete the database.

segment.source: Click OK to apply changes and close the dialog box.
segment.target: Click OK to apply changes and close the dialog box.

segment.source: Click OK to save the changes, or click Cancel to close the dialog box without saving changes.
segment.target: Click OK to save the changes, or click Cancel to close the dialog box without saving changes.

segment.source: If prompted, restart the MED-V server service to apply changes to the network settings.
segment.target: If prompted, restart the MED-V server service to apply changes to the network settings.
